traceability.evidence: 1. CLI flag support: bin/dry-aged-deps.js includes full parsing and validation for --prod-min-age, --dev-min-age, --prod-severity, --dev-severity (lines 200–390), falls back to --min-age/--severity, and enforces range and allowed values. 2. Config file support: bin/dry-aged-deps.js reads top-level and nested prod/dev objects, validating keys minAge/minSeverity under prod/dev (lines 20–100). 3. Dependency type detection: src/print-outdated.js reads package.json and getDependencyType returns 'prod' or 'dev'; tested in test/printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js and in test/printOutdated.test.js (dev case). 4. Fallback/default behavior: general --min-age/--severity flags apply to both prod/dev when specific flags unset; default of 7 days and 'none' severity used otherwise; verified in test/cli.flags.test.js. 5. Validation: invalid values for all thresholds are rejected with exit code 2; tests for --min-age and --severity cover integer, range, and missing‐value cases. 6. Output indication: table output includes a “Type” column and rows end with prod/dev; JSON output includes thresholds for both prod and dev; XML formatter includes and dependencyType attributes; various tests in test/xml-formatter.* and printOutdated.* verify these outputs. 7. Documentation: README.md and --help text list all prod/dev flags and describe fallback behavior.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for story 007.0 (prod/dev thresholds) have been implemented: CLI flags, config schema, dependency-type detection, fallback logic, defaults, validation, output indication, and documentation are present. Unit and integration tests cover threshold logic, fallback, config file precedence, and output formatting for both prod and dev dependencies.
